Articles.Content: Is this a new feature, animation of the antenna dishes at the tracking centre. I have been playing Economic boom for 5 hours and wont be finished till I start to gaze at the blood moon.
This has been a feature since the new KSC was implemented.
That has been a feature since the old KSC was implemented. It's been there at least since I found the game in .15.

Actually the tracking dish has turned even on the OLD KSC...

Also I've never seen a reputation so low... There isn't any number readouts but I'm seeing hazard lines and police tape on your rep bar.

Yeah, I love the tracking station dishes. They look so inspiring...

Also, rocketpilot is right. Good lord, what did you do to your reputation? "Take a bunch of Kerbals, and not horribly kill them"?

Also I've never seen a reputation so low... There isn't any number readouts but I'm seeing hazard lines and police tape on your rep bar.

I love that we can start with negative rep!

Actually the tracking dish has turned even on the OLD KSC...

Also I've never seen a reputation so low... There isn't any number readouts but I'm seeing hazard lines and police tape on your rep bar.

That was so unobservent of me. The dishes never caught my eye before, and well , this time I was spending more time at the KSC. The 2323 kerbal sacrifice to the blood moon was going spectacular and .... um ... well....

I love that we can start with negative rep!

Yeah. Thats the ticket. I started out with negative rep. Yeah. [/shaking eyes]
Hmm that rep bar looks like the result of 10 full hitchhiker containers with 5 SRB's straped on and lit off (4 with symetry and a 5th tacked one to tip it over)
I'd like to know what they are tracking...they are aimed south, and just about everything should be passing directly overhead if it's on the typical equatorial orbit...

I'd like to know what they are tracking...they are aimed south, and just about everything should be passing directly overhead if it's on the typical equatorial orbit...

I heard somewhere that they pick a random celestial object to track, and then switch to a new one when it goes over the horizon.
They have been in there for a while, but I have seen it too. They move faster now.
